alert.note: Alert for Eagle; Garfield; Pitkin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 16 at 2:07PM MST until February 16 at 2:30PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southwestern Eagle County in west central Colorado... Northeastern Pitkin County in west central Colorado... Southeastern Garfield County in west central Colorado... * Until 230 PM MST. * At 207 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located near Basalt, or 21 miles southeast of Glenwood Springs, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect hazardous road conditions. * This includes the following highways... Colorado 82 between mile markers 10 and 41. Colorado 133 between mile markers 61 and 68. Locations impacted include... Aspen, Carbondale, Basalt, Snowmass, Snowmass Village, Meridith, El Jebel, Woody Creek and Emma. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
